history.content: Your best bet may be to take an online EECS class like CSW186 and then add in online breadths.

children.subject: Original Anon here, that makes sense but I think even W186 has in-person midterms and finals. Would appreciate any feedback from the staff as to what official department policy is for missing/making up exams in these situations

history.content: Hello! During the fall 2019 semester, I am planning to intern with 2 companies one after the other. My first job will be in NYC, and the 2nd will be local. I don't want to have to withdraw from Berkeley for the semester, so I was wondering if anyone has experience taking EECS courses remotely while interning away from campus. Is there any kind of remote proctoring that is supported for exams? I will be able to take finals in-person, but will most likely miss midterm 1s and early midterm 2s. As of now, I'm thinking of taking CS 188, Data 8, and a breadth (already taken: 189, 126, 170, lower divs). Thanks for your guidance!
history.subject: Taking courses while interning
